net.getcloudengine

Class CloudQuery

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.getcloudengine.CloudQuery

  • public class CloudQuery
extends java.lang.Object
    CloudQuery class allows the user to query for CloudObjects satisfying a particular condition. The query is typically constructed by making multiple where* method calls on a new CloudQuery object to set the appropriate condition. Then you can call a get or a find method to actually run the query.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CloudQuery

        public CloudQuery(java.lang.String objName)
        Constructs a new CloudQuery
        Parameters:
        objName - name of the CloudObject type that the query is being constructed for. This is the same name that was passed while constructing that particular CloudObject

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public CloudObject get(java.lang.String objId,
              GetCallback callback)
                throws CloudAuthException,
                       CloudException
        Run a query to retrieve a particular object whose objectId is already known. This method fetches the object in the current thread.
        Parameters:
        objId - Unique Id of the object assigned when the object was saved
        callback - The callback function that will be called after the object has been retrieved. Exception information, if any, that occured during the operation will be passed to the callback function.
        Throws:
        CloudAuthException
        CloudException

      • getInBackground

        public void getInBackground(java.lang.String objId,
                   GetCallback callback)
        Run a query to retrieve a particular object whose objectId is already known. This method fetches the object in a background thread.
        Parameters:
        objId - Unique Id of the object assigned when the object was saved
        callback - The callback function that will be called after the object has been retrieved. Exception information, if any, that occured during the operation will be passed to the callback function.

      • findInBackground

        public void findInBackground(FindCallback callback)
        Run a query to retrieve one or more CloudObjects satisfying all the condition set in this query object. This method fetches the objects in a background thread.
        Parameters:
        callback - The callback function that will be called after the objects have been retrieved. Exception information, if any, that occurred during the operation will be passed to the callback function.

      • find

        public java.util.List<CloudObject> find()
                                 throws CloudAuthException,
                                        CloudException
        Run a query to retrieve one or more CloudObjects satisfying all the condition set in this query object. This method fetches the objects in the current thread.
        Parameters:
        callback - The callback function that will be called after the objects have been retrieved. Exception information, if any, that occurred during the operation will be passed to the callback function.
        Throws:
        CloudAuthException
        CloudException

      • whereContainedIn

        public CloudQuery whereContainedIn(java.lang.String key,
                          java.util.Collection<? extends java.lang.Object> values)
        Sets a query condition. The condition checks if the value of a property of a CloudObject matches one of the objects in the given Collection. The CloudObject will be selected if the match is found.
        Parameters:
        key - the name of the property of the CloudObject
        values - Collection containing a set of desirable values that a CloudObject should have. * @return the current query object. You can set more condition on the same object

      • whereDoesNotExist

        public CloudQuery whereDoesNotExist(java.lang.String key)
        Sets a query condition. The condition checks if the CloudObject has some value set for a particular property. The object is not selected if the property is set.
        Parameters:
        key - the name of the property of the CloudObject
        Returns:
        the current query object. You can set more condition on the same object

      • whereEqualTo

        public CloudQuery whereEqualTo(java.lang.String key,
                      java.lang.Object value)
        Sets a query condition. The condition checks whether the value of a given property of a CloudObject is equal to the provided value. The object is selected if the value matches.
        Parameters:
        key - the name of the property of the CloudObject
        value - the desired value of the property
        Returns:
        the current query object. You can set more condition on the same object

        Parameters:
        key - the name of the property of the CloudObject
        Returns:
        the current query object. You can set more condition on the same object

        public CloudQuery whereGreaterThan(java.lang.String key,
                          java.lang.Object value)
        Sets a query condition. The condition checks whether the value of a given property of a CloudObject is greater than the provided value. The object is selected if the object's property value is greater.
        Parameters:

        value - the desired value of the property
        Returns:
        the current query object. You can set more condition on the same object

      • whereMatches

        public CloudQuery whereMatches(java.lang.String key,
                      java.lang.String regex)
        Sets a query condition. The condition checks whether the value of a given string property of a CloudObject matches the given regular expression. The object is selected if there is a match.
        Parameters:
        key - the name of the property of the CloudObject
        regex - the regular expression pattern to match with.
        Returns:
        the current query object. You can set more condition on the same object

      • whereMatches

        public CloudQuery whereMatches(java.lang.String key,
                      java.lang.String regex,
                      java.lang.String modifiers)
        Sets a query condition. The condition checks whether the value of a given string property of a CloudObject matches the given regular expression. The object is selected if there is a match.
        Parameters:
        key - the name of the property of the CloudObject
        regex - the regular expression pattern to match with.
        modifiers - the following PCRE modifiers can be provided i - Case insensitive regex matching m - regex matching across multiple lines
        Returns:
        the current query object. You can set more condition on the same object

      • whereNotContainedIn

        public CloudQuery whereNotContainedIn(java.lang.String key,
                             java.util.Collection<? extends java.lang.Object> values)
        Sets a query condition. The condition checks if the value of a property of a CloudObject matches any of the objects in the given Collection. The CloudObject will not be selected if the match is found.
        Parameters:
        key - the name of the property of the CloudObject
        values - Collection containing a set of desirable values that a CloudObject should have. * @return the current query object. You can set more condition on the same object

      • whereNotEqualTo

        public CloudQuery whereNotEqualTo(java.lang.String key,
                         java.lang.Object value)
        Sets a query condition. The condition checks whether the value of a given property of a CloudObject is equal to the provided value. The object is selected if the value doesn't match.
        Parameters:
        key - the name of the property of the CloudObject
        value - the desired value of the property
        Returns:
        the current query object. You can set more condition on the same object
